page.title: 13Wild life
page.content: There is a fair amount of wild life, because the area has both{conifer}and {mixed woods.}Mixed woods are well stocked with birds such as Tawny Owl,Jay,Rook,Woodcock,Mistle thrush, Sparrow hawk,spotted woodpecker,finch, blue tits and warblers. There are many {farmland birds}like Snipe,Lapwing, Robin,Blackbird,Songthrush,Chaffinch, Moorhen,Jackdaw,Magpie,Starling, Wood-pigeon .Some{rarer birds}are Honey Buzzards.{Mammals}include many foxes,badgers,stoats,weasels,rabbits and hares.Not so common are two pairs of Roe Deer in{Nash Woods,}also Adders. There have been sightings of Pine Martins in{Radnor Forest.}There are many{pests}for the farmer and forester, e.g. grey squirrels,mink,and mice. Researched by Stephen Langford,Darren Cartwright.
